item.title: A Fly Tipping problem has been found, 1st September
item.description:
The fly tip is on the ramp leading up to Elmbridge walk.

item.title: Mattress dumped on pavement and other household items at both number 40 and44, 1st September
item.description:
My Mum Irene Morgan lives at number 42 Alexandra Road Erith DA83PY both sides of neighbours have dump household items on the pavement the mattress is layed across the pavement and very dangerous as there is a of elderly and vulnerable people who use the street my Mum is 81 years old and owns her property but both neighbours are rented out my Mum gets so stressed with the constant dumping and has finally had the alleyway cleaned after years of people dumping only for her neighbours to now start dumping on the pavement outside it is very upsetting for my and makes the road look very untidy and my Mum fears that it will encourage others to dump as well
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Too many tables and boards, 1st September
item.description:
I would like to raise a concern regarding the café located on Church Street Sapid coffee. The business frequently places multiple tables, chairs, and large boards on the pavement, which significantly obstructs pedestrian access.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Fencing and overgrown plants, 1st September
item.description:
Fencing between the school grounds and St Stephen's Mews has collapsed with all the overgrown plants which look like most are dead. This is causing damage to the wall in between and all the residents cars parked on the side of St Stephen's Mews. This needs taking down or replacing. This has been getting worse over the last 6months and needs attention before winter/stormy weather causes more damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, St Stephen's Mews, Maida Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hackney council keep saying Walford Road Litter problem is fixed IT IS NOT, 1st September
item.description:
Hackney Council keep signing off Walford Road litter reports with “Problem now fixed”. It is not. Nor has it ever been. I am standing on the street now & it is littered in Best Turkish Kebab takeaway wrappers & food. Please may someone take this seriously
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nitrous oxide canisters (Fastgas) being dumped here, 1st September
item.description:
These appear to be being dumped here fairly regularly as the number of them is increasing. They are behind the dustbins, against the wall of the electrical station. I understand that disposing of such containers is a problem, as they cannot go in with the recycling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another car drove into a bollard on Cotmandene Crescen, 1st September
item.description:
Hope you have had a good bank holiday? Last night another car drove into a bollard on Cotmandene Crescent. I am told they said it was due to the way the light was shining they didn’t see the dark bollard. Is it possible to have it painted a light colour green to help, similar to the one on the other side of the road?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Cotmandene Crescent, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
